Class Tile

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.Tile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Tile extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a tile object that can be part of a game board. Each tile is associated with a specific component and has a set of connectors, coordinates, and rotation properties. Tile objects can be manipulated, rotated, cloned, and updated as part of the game state. This class supports serialization for game state persistence and includes functionality to interact with the parent player board and events.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      public Tile()
      Represents a Tile object in a system. This class serves as a foundational component for creating and managing tile-based structures, layouts, or entities. The default constructor initializes a new Tile instance with no specific properties defined.

    • Tile

      public Tile(Component component, Connectors... connectors)
      Constructs a Tile instance with the specified component and connectors.
      Parameters:
      component - the component associated with the Tile
      connectors - the connectors to be added to the Tile

  • Method Details

    • RotateSx

      public void RotateSx()
      Rotates the tile counterclockwise by adjusting its connectors and component orientation. This method performs two main operations: 1. Rotates the list of connectors associated with the tile by one position in the counterclockwise direction. 2. Invokes the rotation logic of the tile's component to update its orientation accordingly. The rotation ensures that the tile's connectors and the underlying component are aligned to reflect the new orientation after the operation. This is useful in scenarios where the tile's configuration needs to be adjusted dynamically during gameplay.

    • RotateDx

      public void RotateDx()
      Rotates the Tile instance in the clockwise direction by adjusting its connectors and invoking the rotation of its associated component. The method performs two primary actions: 1. Rotates the list of connectors by one position to represent a clockwise rotation. 2. Invokes the `rotate` method on the associated component with a `true` parameter indicating a clockwise rotation.

    • clone

      public Tile clone(PlayerBoard clonedPlayerBoard)
      Creates and returns a deep copy of this Tile object with updated references for the cloned PlayerBoard and other related components.
      Parameters:
      clonedPlayerBoard - the PlayerBoard instance to associate with the cloned Tile
      Returns:
      a new Tile object that is a deep copy of this Tile

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier associated with this object.
      Returns:
      the unique identifier as an integer

    • setId

      public void setId(int id)
      Sets the identifier for this instance.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier to be assigned

    • getComponent

      public Component getComponent()
      Retrieves the component associated with the tile.
      Returns:
      the component of the tile

    • setComponent

      public void setComponent(Component component)
      Sets the component associated with this tile.
      Parameters:
      component - the component to be assigned to this tile

    • getConnectors

      public ArrayList<Connectors> getConnectors()
      Retrieves the list of connectors associated with the tile. The connectors define the connection interfaces of the tile and determine its compatibility with adjacent tiles in the system.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the connectors associated with the tile

    • setConnectors

      public void setConnectors(ArrayList<Connectors> connectors)
      Sets the list of connectors for the tile. The connectors define the points on a tile where connections can be made to other tiles, determining adjacency and compatibility rules. This method allows updating the connectors for the tile as needed.
      Parameters:
      connectors - an ArrayList of Connectors representing the connectors to be assigned to the tile. Must not be null and must contain valid connector instances implementing the Connectors interface.

    • controlDirections

      public boolean controlDirections(PlayerBoard pb, int x, int y)
      Checks the validity of directions based on the provided player board and coordinates.
      Parameters:
      pb - the PlayerBoard instance for which the directions need to be validated
      x - the x-coordinate to be checked
      y - the y-coordinate to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the directions are valid, false otherwise

    • sendUpdates

      public void sendUpdates(ArrayList<Goods> cargo, int humans, boolean purpleAlien, boolean brownAlien, int batteries)
      Sends updates related to the current tile, including cargo details, human count, alien presence, and battery information, to the associated player board.
      Parameters:
      cargo - A list of goods being carried (may be null).
      humans - The number of humans present on the tile.
      purpleAlien - A boolean indicating the presence of a purple alien on the tile.
      brownAlien - A boolean indicating the presence of a brown alien on the tile.
      batteries - The number of batteries available on the tile.

    • sendUpdates

      public void sendUpdates()
      Sends updates related to a tile removal event. This method processes a RemoveTileEvent and sends the corresponding updates using the player board.

    • setPlayerBoard

      public void setPlayerBoard(PlayerBoard playerBoard)
      Sets the player's board for this tile.
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the PlayerBoard object to be associated with this tile

    • setX

      public void setX(int x)
      Sets the x-coordinate of the tile.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate to be set for the tile

    • setY

      public void setY(int y)
      Sets the y-coordinate value for the Tile object.
      Parameters:
      y - the integer value to set as the y-coordinate

    • setChosen

      public void setChosen()
      Marks the tile as chosen by setting the `chosen` field to true. This method updates the state of the tile to indicate that it has been selected or marked for a specific purpose. The `chosen` field is a boolean property representing the selection status of the tile.

    • getChosen

      public boolean getChosen()
      Retrieves the value of the chosen state for the tile.
      Returns:
      true if the tile is chosen; false otherwise

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(int rotations)
      Sets the rotation of the object by a specified number of degrees. Updates the current rotation value and ensures that it stays within a range of 0 to 359 degrees.
      Parameters:
      rotations - the number of degrees to rotate the object. Positive values indicate clockwise rotation, while negative values indicate counter-clockwise rotation.
